item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 15, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Sweden is investing €104M to bring back printed textbooks (32 points | 4 comments)
2. Ropey – A UTF8 text rope for manipulating and editing large texts. in Rust (131 points | 49 comments)
3. Why does Cloudflare Pages have such a generous free tier? (203 points | 137 comments)
4. A Marriage Proposal Spoken in Office Jargon (196 points | 70 comments)
5. Why the weak nuclear force is short range (246 points | 100 comments)
6. Lambda Calculus in 383 Bytes (2022) (174 points | 30 comments)

10. Lago – Open-Source Usage Based Billing – Is Hiring Technical Account Executives ( | hide)
11. Sky-scanning complete for Gaia (99 points | 29 comments)
12. Arnold's Cat (2018) (11 points | discuss)
13. KEON is a human-readable serde format that syntactic similar to Rust (23 points | 11 comments)

22. Home Loss File System (349 points | 90 comments)
23. Generate audiobooks from E-books with Kokoro-82M (341 points | 203 comments)

26. Nevada Court Shuts Down Police Use of Federal Loophole for Civil Forfeiture (387 points | 214 comments)

28. Das Blinkenlights (123 points | 64 comments)
29. Rsync vulnerabilities (98 points | 14 comments)
30. Transformer^2: Self-Adaptive LLMs (130 points | 44 comments)
